attributes.comment:
Dear Sirs,
While I understand the importance of the Department of Home Security, I am
having a hard understanding the necessity of raising the fees by 66%. I am
adopting a baby from China and have already paid you $615.00 in fees. The
waiting time in China has lengthened considerably and now I am facing having to
redo my 1600A and fingerprinting (another $615.00). There have been many bills
introduced in the House to extend the length of the I171-H and I can't
understand if you are trying to reduce the backup why these times are not
extended in the event of adoption. You state that I must submit everything
again, and I consider that a big waste of your time and mine. I would think
that as long as the paperwork is completed and submitted to a country for
adoption that the timeline would hold until the paperwork in that country was
done. I find that the current amount to be EXCESSIVE if I have to do it TWICE
for the SAME adoption. I think it's absurd and a waste of taxpayers money to
REDO this paperwork more than once and then charge even higher fees. I consider
this raise to be excessive. I only get a 2-3% raise a year, so maybe a raise by
10% would be acceptable. I don't think it necessary to increase the fees by 66%
unless you extend the amount of time that my I171H is good for by 66%. That
should cover just about all who are adopting and facing a very long wait.
Thank you for your time,
Kim A. O'Connell
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kim O'Connell
